other: CaMa-Flood is a river routing model used for flood simulation.
PBS is a batch queuing system used to submit and manage jobs on a cluster.
The script uses Fortran to run the main CaMa-Flood program.
The script requires a certain number of CPUs, memory, disk space, and network bandwidth to run.
The script is designed to run on a cluster and uses PBS to manage resources.
The script has a number of configuration settings that can be modified to customize the simulation.
These settings include the simulation time, the forcing data, the map data, and the output data.
